poem:
Indirect Dialogues  

In Oman,  
a desert breeze  
carries whispers—  
two nations  
stand apart,  
each word a seed  
sown in silence.  
  
Intentions  
are the soil,  
fractured as the earth—  
hope murmurs  
between lines,   
and waits  
for rain.
